channel.title: Goddamn no-ip!
channel.description:
i have tried everything i can possibly think of to run no-ip but every time i try to log in i get error connecting to server i have
a) allowed the port b) made a rule in the firewall tab c) added it under applications tab
if anyone wants to help me post here
i have a DI-624 router and am on wireless internet plz someone help im about to throw my laptop out the window

item.title: Goddamn no-ip!
item.dc:creator: @damon damon
item.description:
@damon wrote:

no the server is running and no-ip is running have no clue why it wont work

@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Okay. I’m gonna try your server out. Trust me. I’m gonna go insane when I see the amount of errors I get. Listen to my problem. My compiler doesn’t work right now so I’ve been editing loads of stuff. What happens when I compile if I get 600 errors. I’m fucked.

Anyway lol runserver and I’ll try to connect, if I succeed you should see from your runserver.bat file. Meh, I’ll tell you here anyway. So post back once you’ve got it running.

43594 Port right?

item.title: Goddamn no-ip!
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

MoparScape listens to ALL ports. Most WebClients don’t listen to 43594, MoparScape does. Anyways, tell me the No-IP your using to connect.

Try not to fucking swear mmkay? I’m trying to help you out the best I can.

Read full topic

item.title: Goddamn no-ip!
item.dc:creator: @damon damon
item.description:
@damon wrote:

i have fucking done all that im not a fucking idiot but i think it has something to do with moparscape not listening to the right port

Read full topic

item.title: Goddamn no-ip!
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Go in your source file, be it Phone, Testscape w,e. Double click runserver. Leave the window that pops up open, if you close it, it closes the server down.

Now you’ve done that, go on to MoparScape. (www.moparisthebest.com) Make sure your using the correct port. It will probably be default, (43594) in which case don’t bother trying to change the port, everytime you load MoparScape it’s set to 43594 for the port. That’s why it’s default -.-

Now you type in your username, password. Blah blah. The Server IP is where you put in your No-IP address, E.G serverscape.servegame.com, serverscape.no-ip.info etc, etc.

If it doesn’t go as smoothly as that. Meaning if that all doesn’t work. I won’t be able to answer your problems. I’m stuck atm with my compiler.

Anyway, is that in your language? Do you understand now? Comprende?

Read full topic

not asking just pointing out

item.description:

well im not exactly to sure i am guessing yes

this is what i have done

in virtual server i added

name - damonscape
ip address - 192.168.0.1
protocol type - both
private port - 43594
public port - 43594
and checked it for always
